channel.title: Bare Metal Cloud Status - Incident History

item.title: [ERI1][Dedicated Servers] - Rack E101A19/B08/B11/B12
item.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Feb 12, 07:00 - 10:00 UTC

Jan 23, 16:21 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our Dedicated Servers offer on the specified racks.

This may temporarily affect availability.

Start time : 12/02/2025 07:00 UTC
End time : 12/02/2025 10:00 UTC
Service impact : Each server in racks E101A19, E101B08, E101B11 and E101B12 will be unreachable for 30 minutes during the maintenance.
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy of our infrastructure, our teams will migrate servers one by one from racks E101A19, E101B08, E101B11 and E101B12 to rack E105A08.

Thank you for your understanding.

item.title: [Global][Baremetal] - efiBootloaderPath mandatory as input for BringYourOwnImage BringYourOwnLinux
item.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Feb 5, 11:00 - 11:30 UTC

Jan 7, 15:47 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our Baremetal offer.

Start time : 05/02/2025 11:00 UTC
End time : 05/02/2025 11:30 UTC
Service impact : Starting next month, the EfiBootloaderPath will be required as an input for BringYourOwnImage and BringYourOwnLinux operating systems.
Service improvement : This change will enable customers to customize their EFI bootloader path, if you have any questions or need further clarification, please contact Support.

Follow the links below for the documentation.
BringYourOwnLinux: https://ovh.to/8stqmx3
BringYourOwnImage: https://ovh.to/fRZWyVr

Thank you for your understanding.

item.title: [EU][Dedicated Server] - Rescue mode or installations operating system incident notification
item.description:
Jan 24, 00:35 UTC
Update - The servers are still functional, only the rescue mode is affected.
Update will be posted as significant progress is made.

Thank you for your understanding

Jan 24, 00:24 UTC
Update - We are currently experiencing an incident affecting our Dedicated Servers offering, which is causing temporary functionality issues in the EU region.

Here is detail for this incident :
Start time : 23/01/2025 23:24 UTC
Impacted Service(s) : functionality.
Customers Impact : Currently it is impossible to boot servers in rescue mode or installations operating system only in EU regions.
Ongoing Actions : Our teams are investigating to determine the origin of the incident to fix it. 

Update will be posted as significant progress is made.
Our teams are fully engaged and working to resolve the issue as quickly as possible. We will keep you updated on the progress and resolution.
We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.

Jan 24, 00:24 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Jan 23, 23:57 UTC
Investigating - We are currently experiencing an event affecting our Dedicated Servers offer.
Start time : 23/01/2025 23:24 UTC

Our teams are fully committed to investigating this issue and working towards a resolution as soon as possible. As investigations are ongoing, we will share any new findings or updates with you as soon as possible.

We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.

item.title: [GRA6/8][Virtual Private Servers] - Network maintenance notification
item.description:
Jan 22, 21:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Dec 24, 10:31 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our network infrastructure.

This may temporarily affect availability.

Start time : 22/01/2025 21:00 UTC
End time : 23/01/2025 05:00 UTC
Service impact : None. Except during the rollback phase (scheduled between 01:00 UTC and 02:00 UTC), access to running Virtual Private Servers instances will not be possible during 1 to 5 mins.
Service improvement : Following our continuous improvement policy of our products and services, we will carry out a network hardware upgrade in our Graveline Datacenters.

The operation is carried out in several steps:

- Step 1: Preparation of the operation (about 3 hours)
- Step 2: New hardware implementation (about 2 hours)
- Step 3: Test and activation of the new hardware (about 2 hours)
We would like to inform you that during the second phase of our upcoming operation, scheduled for between 01:00 and 02:00 UTC, a rollback may be required. In this case, VPS instances will continue to run, but access will be temporarily impacted for a duration of less than 5 minutes.
